thread.title: How wet-suit pioneer Jack O’Neill shaped surfing culture
thread.title_full: How wet-suit pioneer Jack O’Neill shaped surfing culture - San Francisco Chronicle

author: By Eric Gustafson
title: How wet-suit pioneer Jack O’Neill shaped surfing culture
text:
Photo: Michael Macor, The Chronicle print_article_embed|photo-2990995|article-6431340|7 comments_jump_embed|photo-2990995|article-6431340|1 email_share_embed|photo-2990995|article-6431340|1 facebook_share_embed|photo-2990995|article-6431340|2 twitter_share_embed|photo-2990995|article-6431340|3 pinterest_share_embed|photo-2990995|article-6431340|4 reddit_share_embed|photo-2990995|article-6431340|5 google_share_embed|photo-2990995|article-6431340|6 Jack O’Neill who lost his left eye in a 1972 surfing accident, looks out at the ocean from his cliff-side home in Santa Cruz in 2012. Jack O’Neill who lost his left eye in a 1972 surfing accident,...
Jack O’Neill, the founder of the first and most successful surfing wet-suit company in the world, has long had the financial means to live anywhere he wants. Jack O’Neill who lost his left eye in a 1972 surfing accident, looks out at the ocean from his cliff-side home in Santa Cruz in 2012. Jack O’Neill who lost his left eye in a 1972 surfing accident,...
Jack O’Neill, the founder of the first and most successful surfing wet-suit company in the world, has long had the financial means to live anywhere he wants.
